net.java.dev.eval.example.calculator
Class Calculator

java.lang.Object
  net.java.dev.eval.example.calculator.Calculator

public class Calculator
extends Object

A till roll calculator example.

A command line program that uses Expression to evaluate the expression input on each line of standard input, and then echos the answer to standard output. This is similar to the Unix tool "bc".

When an input line that contains an equals (=) then the expression to the right is evaluated and assigned to the variable named on the left.

A line containing the single word "show" causes all current variable to be output. The word "quit" ends the program.

Example: 

 $ java -jar calculator.jar 
 x = 4*4
 y = 5*5
 x + y
 41
 
 show
 {x=16, y=25}
 quit

Author:
Reg Whitton
